item.title: Report E-2024100312
item.description:
Report E-2024100312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:40 AM ET, Paul Harper with LHO (new terminal) contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Houston, TX. The spill consists of approximately 30 gallons of Unisol Liquid Red B-75, which released from (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. Contractors deployed absorbents into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pads, PPE and pallet were collected and containerized into (4) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was placed into (1) 95-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100298
item.description:
Report E-2024100298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: LUBBOCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:48 AM ET, LLB contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Lubbock, TX. The spill consists of approximately 6 ounces of Liquid Fury 270, which released from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a small pinhole at the bottom of the drum that was caused during dock operations. The contractors overpacked the drum into (1) 85-gallon metal drum and staged the waste for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100269
item.description:
Report E-2024100269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: GRAPEVINE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UAC Intl
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Another IAC arranged the delivery of the freight by shipper to our facility on Sep 18th, 2024. As an IAC-CCSF, we were advised to screen & transfer the freight to the air carrier of the shipment for airlines booking made via the other IAC. There was a pick up truck which arrived to our facility to deliver the crate and when the driver was asked to provide proper identification and sign our check-in sheet, he left w/o either. We, UAC INT'L, notified the IAC about this incident. Due to the suspicious delivery activity, we opened the crate which we did not accept on behalf of the IAC and discovered 3 loose Lithium Ion Batteries in the crate. We notified the IAC and DFW TSA of the incident accordingly.

item.title: Report E-2024100222
item.description:
Report E-2024100222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1134 ET, XPO terminal LTY notified ERTS of a cargo refused shipment that took place 08/2024. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Amazing Product Liquid Fire Drain Line Opener released from (1) 1-ounce plastic container due to reasons unknown. The release impacted cardboard box the product is overpacked in. The release has since dried, as it happened over a month ago but was just today sent back to them from the customer. The terminal will reach out to the shipper to see if shipper would like the product returned to them. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used oil dri as an absorbent and a 30-gallon poly drum for the waste. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100192
item.description:
Report E-2024100192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:01 EST, ERTS was contacted XPO Logistics about a cargo release. It was reported due to a forklift incident, approximately .5 gallon of Chlorine Bleach 2000 (hazardous - UN1791) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri were placed into a 65-gallon poly drum and staged in for terminal personnel to handle. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
